item.title: Co-op confirms data of 6.5 million members stolen in cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: UK retailer Co-op has confirmed that personal data of 6.5 million members was stolen in the massive cyberattack in April that shut down systems and caused food shortages in its grocery stores. [...]

item.title: U.S. Army soldier pleads guilty to extorting 10 tech, telecom firms
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A 21-year old former U.S. Army soldier pleaded guilty to charges of hacking and extorting at least ten telecommunications and technology companies in the country. [...]

item.title: Louis Vuitton says regional data breaches tied to same cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Luxury fashion giant Louis Vuitton confirmed that breaches impacting customers in the UK, South Korea, and Turkey stem from the same security incident, which is believed to be linked to the ShinyHunters extortion group. [...]

item.title: Cloudflare says 1.1.1.1 outage not caused by attack or BGP hijack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: To quash speculation of a cyberattack or BGP hijack incident causing the recent 1.1.1.1 Resolver service outage, Cloudflare explains in a post mortem that the incident was caused by an internal misconfiguration. [...]

item.title: SonicWall SMA devices hacked with OVERSTEP rootkit tied to ransomware
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: A threat actor has been deploying a previously unseen malware called OVERSTEP that modifies the boot process of fully-patched but no longer supported SonicWall Secure Mobile Access appliances. [...]

item.title: New Fortinet FortiWeb hacks likely linked to public RCE exploits
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Multiple Fortinet FortiWeb instances recently infected with web shells are believed to have been compromised using public exploits for a recently patched remote code execution (RCE) flaw tracked as CVE-2025-25257. [...]

item.title: Europol disrupts pro-Russian NoName057(16) DDoS hacktivist group
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: An international law enforcement operation dubbed "Operation Eastwood" has targeted the infrastructure of the pro-Russian hacktivist group NoName057(16), responsible for distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks across Europe and the US. [...]

item.title: Grok 4 benchmark results: Tops math, ranks second in coding
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Grok 4 is a huge leap from Grok 3, but how good is it compared to other models in the market, such as Gemini 2.5 Pro? We now have answers, thanks to new independent benchmarks. [...]

item.title: Google fixes actively exploited sandbox escape zero day in Chrome
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google has released a security update for Chrome to address half a dozen vulnerabilities, one of them actively exploited by attackers to escape the browser's sandbox protection. [...]

item.title: OpenAI's image model gets built-in style feature on ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI's image gen model, which is available via ChatGPT for free, now lets you easily create AI images even if you're not familiar with trends or prompt engineering. [...]

item.title: Abacus dark web drug market goes offline in suspected exit scam
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Abacus Market, the largest Western darknet marketplace supporting Bitcoin payments, has shut down its public infrastructure in a move suspected to be an exit scam. [...]

item.title: Windows KB5064489 emergency update fixes Azure VM launch issues
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released an emergency update to fix a bug that prevents Azure virtual machines from launching when the Trusted Launch setting is disabled and Virtualization-Based Security (VBS) is enabled. [...]

item.title: North Korean XORIndex malware hidden in 67 malicious npm packages
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: North Korean threat actors planted 67 malicious packages in the Node Package Manager (npm) online repository to deliver a new malware loader called XORIndex to developer systems. [...]
